Polish Diplomats Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Polish Diplomats Help Korean Farmers 
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Wojciech Kaluza and officials of the Polish embassy here Tuesday went to the DPRK-Poland Friendship Jangsuwon Cooperative-Farm in Samsok District, Pyongyang.
 They helped farmers in bean thrashing. During break they conversed with farmers and enjoyed an art performance, deepening the friendship.    
 The ambassador said he was deeply impressed to see successes made by the farmers whenever he visited the farm. He hoped that the farm would make greater success in the agricultural production and the friendly relations between Poland and the DPRK grow stronger

Mongolian Prime Minister Here
articles.content:
Mongolian Prime Minister Here 
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Prime Minister Nambariin Enkhbayar arrived here today by air to pay an official visit to the DPRK at the invitation of Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet.
 He was accompanied by his wife, Chimeddorjiin Ganzorig, minister of Commerce and Industry, Sukhbaatariin Batbold, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Tsedeviin Dashdorj, member of the State Great Hural, Miyegombiin Enkhbold, mayor of Ulaan Baatar, Janchivdorjiin Adya, governor of Dundgov Province, Yondongiin Otgonbayar, advisor to the prime minister on foreign policy, Daadanhuugiin Batbaatar, director of the State Special Inspection Bureau, and others.    
 They were greeted at the airport by Pak Pong Ju, Ri Kwang Gun, minister of Foreign Trade, Mun Il Bong, minister of Finance who is chairman of the Korea-Mongolia Friendship Association, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jong Sik, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, and other officials concerned and Ambassador E.P. Janchivdorjyn Lomvo and staff officials of the Mongolian embassy here.
 A welcome ceremony took place at the airport.

New Piston Packing for Shuttleless Loom Made
articles.content:
New Piston Packing for Shuttleless Loom Made
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Researchers of Pyongyang College of Technology have made a new piston packing for shuttleless loom with raw materials abundant in the country.
 The former packing made of cowhide or pigskin is expensive in the production cost but short in the serviceable life.    
 The cost of the new packing is one tenth of the former and its serviceable life is more than 20 years.

articles.title: Greetings to Sultan of Oman
articles.content:
Greetings to Sultan of Oman
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Sultan Qaboos Bin Said Al Said on Nov. 17 on the occasion of the national day of the Sultanate of Oman.
 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the sultan greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country.
